summary: This document is an email from Jeffrey Epstein to Jes Staley discussing the behavior of bankers who have taken money and paid themselves bonuses while not assisting the general public. Epstein suggests a strategy for Staley to adopt in dealing with these bankers, implying a good cop-bad cop approach. The email also contains a confidentiality notice.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email, discussing bankers and suggesting a strategy for Jes Staley.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is the recipient of the email, receiving advice from Epstein regarding interactions with bankers.

connections.description: Epstein is providing advice to Staley regarding bankers, indicating a level of familiarity and collaboration.

keyFacts: The email discusses bankers who have taken money and paid themselves bonuses.
Epstein suggests a strategy for Staley to adopt in dealing with these bankers.
The email contains a confidentiality notice indicating the communication is privileged.
